definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: you don't release the hawk until you've seen the hare (idiom)/one doesn't act before one is sure to succeed
pinyin: bu4 jian4 tu4 zi5 bu4 sa1 ying1

definition: rabbits don't have long tails (idiom)/its days are numbered/won't last long
pinyin: tu4 zi5 wei3 ba5 chang2 bu5 liao3

sentences.english: He went to a warren in which there were a great number of rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 他到了一个养兔场，那里有许多的兔子。

sentences.english: The conjurer waved his magic wand and pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师挥舞魔杖，从帽子里拉出一只兔子。

sentences.english: That night the smallest rabbit hid in the grass by the pool.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，最小的兔子藏在小池边的矮树丛里。

sentences.english: One day while a rabbit was walking by a hill he heard someone calling.
sentences.chinese: 一天当兔子在山角下散步时，听到有人在呼救。

sentences.english: He could not get a hare again; instead he was laughed at by the people of Song.
sentences.chinese: 兔子他再也得不到，他自己反倒被宋国人嘲笑了。

sentences.english: Long-haired breeds will benefit from daily attention to keep their coats smooth.
sentences.chinese: 每天注意要让长毛品种兔子的皮毛滑顺，对其有益。

sentences.english: A little rabbit is picking mushrooms in a forest. A wolf is coming. He is very hungry.
sentences.chinese: 一只小兔子正在森林里采蘑菇，一只狼来了，他很饿。

sentences.english: Rabbit and refuses to obey, and race results ranked in the dragon's front.
sentences.chinese: 兔子又不服，和龙赛跑，结果排在了龙的前面。

sentences.english: The name of the rabbit is not recorded.
sentences.chinese: 不知道那兔子叫啥名字。

sentences.english: It was Ishtar´s Sunday and was celebrated with rabbits and eggs.
sentences.chinese: 它是伊师塔的星期日，和以兔子及蛋庆祝。

sentences.english: He threw his hoe away and lay by the tree every day, dreaming for more rabbits to come.
sentences.chinese: 他扔掉锄头，每天躺在树边，梦想有兔子来。

sentences.english: The rabbits were eventually slaughtered and eaten, too.
sentences.chinese: 这些兔子最后也是被杀了吃肉。

sentences.english: I shot at the rabbit, but missed it.
sentences.chinese: 我向那只兔子射击，但射飞了。

sentences.english: Blood flecks grass of the rabbit form.
sentences.chinese: 血滴在兔子造型的草叶上。

sentences.english: So the big rabbit sat on his hind feet. He reached the top of the basket.
sentences.chinese: 于是，大兔子用后腿站起来，这样就够着了筐的上沿。
